description: On the front of this funerary vessel, a young warrior and a tutor or philosopher are shown standing in a naiskos, or tomb, surrounded by attendants with offerings. Above them is the head of the mythical poet and singer Orpheus. On the back, another tomb is decorated with large white figures, which may be symbolic representations of the dead or may depict marble statues of the tomb’s occupants.
artist_info:
Attributed to the Painter of Copenhagen 4223
Greek; Apulia
Italy
title: Volute Krater (Mixing Bowl)
